history.text: I agree with the third critic. I smiled, but it was pretty forgettable.

Hello! I just watched despicable me and I thought it was fantastic. I loved how the main character was a "Villain" Instead of a hero. It was a refreshing change don'
t you think?
I did like that they did it from the perspective of the villain, it was interesting!
Oh! I see we have differing opinions lol. I really thought it was great and I would have to disagree with the third critic.
That's okay! I just didn't really think it was for me.
Yes! Gru was a great character and like critic number two, I do agree it was a very funny movie. I think its really cool how this was the debut animation film for Illumination Entertainment.
Thats okay! Differing opinions are cool.
Has Illumination released anything since?
I'm not sure but I did enjoy steve carrell's performance as gru. The whole cast was great. Who was your favorite?
Probably Russell Brand!
Russel brand is my second favorite! I thought the plot of stealing the moon was hilarious. The absolute absurdity of a a plan like that made me crack up.
That was pretty funny. I also love the idea of a Bank of Evil.

Same. I thought it was a great sub plot for parents and young adults to enjoy because we've all been there at a bank. I definitely empathized with G
ru when he had to apply for a loan.
Of course. The idea that Gru would have to get the shrink ray first is a little silly, but there are definite real-life parallels.

Agreed, it is silly which makes the juxtaposition between getting the seriousness of applying for a loan and stealing the moon even more funny. Its a nice blend of entertainment for adults and kids and I really appreciate that.
I guess one of my problems with it was the gimmicky 3D. It didn't bother most of the people who watched it but I didn't enjoy it.
Yeah 3d is something you either love or hate. I didn't mind it. The addition of the girls really made gru's character complex. We can see him becoming conflicted over what really matters to him.
Right. It was interesting to see Gru have to choose between stealing the moon and going to a ballet recital.

I liked the ballet recital was something so mundane and girly amidst all the "villainy" gru was trying to do. It really humanized gru as a character. My favorite scene was when he took the girls to the theme park. I thought that was adorable.
I also felt that way when the girls offered their piggy bank to pay the Minions. That was very sweet.
I thought so too. That actually may be my actual favorite scene. It was too cute.

I did think their names were strange though. Margo, edith,
 and Agnes,are very interesting names for young girls.
They were very antiquated! I don't know any people in this day and age with names like that.
Yeah, they were like old lady names.
I thought it was funny that he actually was able to steal the moon. I was a little scared when the girl got kidnapped though.
I figured nothing too bad would happen to the girls in a kids' movie, but it was a pretty daring rescue. I was almost worried for them!
true, but thats how good of a movie it was to me. I was so caught up in the story I almost believed it for a moment. Im glad they were able to be rescued.
I was too. I guess the thing about how a bigger object's shrinkage would wear off more quickly added a bit of danger to everything.

It was cutting it short since it a mid-air rescue. I'
m glad vector disappeared with the moon. He was too much of a villain.
Wait, you thought the villain in a movie about villains was too much of a villain?
I mean there's stealing buildings and then stealing kids. That's going a bit too far for me.
